function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of contact with hands, minimizing contact with door handles and elevator buttons can reduce the risk of contamination specifically for covid-19.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate disinfection measures for contaminated items and spaces","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Balconies as places for communication and social activities may facilitate the spread of contagious diseases between neighbors and residents.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Balconies as areas for observation and leisure activities can lead to close proximity and interaction between individuals, increasing the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of balconies for daily activities like drying laundry and storing items can potentially spread contaminants or pathogens in the air or on surfaces.","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cooperation and interaction in residential balconies can lead to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Aesthetic use of balconies can lead to overcrowding and close proximity, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Balconies used as smoking places","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Poor ventilation and air circulation on the balcony can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Workplace safety and occupational exposure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate cleaning and maintenance of balcony materials may harbor germs and contribute to the spread of diseases.","category":"Failure to implement preventive measures","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proximity of individuals in apartment buildings during the pandemic","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential exposure to covid-19 due to increased time spent at home","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Frequent use of balconies for social activities and food storage increases the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased time spent at home and on balconies during the pandemic may have led to higher exposure to contaminants and air pollutants.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of significant difference in regression analysis suggests potential limitations in understanding the impact of demographic factors on health and disease transmission within the built environment.","category":"Misinterpretation of data and education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased use of balconies during the pandemic may lead to higher potential for contagious disease transmission.","category":"Public health messaging and education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation on small balconies may limit air circulation and increase the risk of airborne disease transmission.","category":"Workplace safety
